Description: Body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup, pprobbly a cup with everted rim; interior glazed black; exterior: reserved band in handle zone; glazed below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer suggests that the sherd might come from a Type 5 or Type 9 South Ionian cup with everted rim. The lack of rim and other diagnostic elements prevents the confirmation on the cup shape. Type 5 cups amongst the earliest South Ionian cups at Naukratis and are relatively rare at the site. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18). Type 9 cups were the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis and the shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Both types have been found in large numbers at in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 54, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.095) (Phase 3)
